bestBHT.bht: Rejoice, O Gentiles, along with his people, Israel. The Scripture calls for the nations to join in merry-making with the Jews, celebrating the interposition of God on their behalf. The Old Testament speaks of the Gentiles being called to celebrate the praises of God, and the apostle Paul infers that they too will be introduced to the same privileges as the Jewish people. Let the nations praise Israel, for in the knowledge of God there is true joy.

Henry Alford: 10.] again he saith,—or, it saith, viz. the Scripture, which is in substance the same.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: 10. And again— ( :-, though there is some difficulty in the Hebrew).
Albert Barnes: The 'nations' or Gentiles are called on to rejoice with the Jews, for the interposition of God in their behalf.
The Old Testament speaks of the Gentiles as called on to celebrate the praises of God.
The apostle infers that they are to be introduced to the same privileges as his people.
Marvin Vincent: Rejoice [ευφρανθητε] . Frequently in the New Testament of merry - making. Luke 12:19; Luke 14:23, Luke 14:24. See on fared sumptuously, Luke 16:19.
John Calvin: Exult and rejoice let the Gentiles, because thou judgest the nations in equity, and the Gentiles on the earth thou guidest.
Paul adds, with his people, and he did this by way of explanation; for the Prophet in that psalm no doubt connects the Gentiles with Israel, and invites both alike to rejoice.
There is no joy without the knowledge of God.
Philip Schaff: Rejoice, ye Gentiles, with his people.
But our Hebrew text reads: 'Rejoice, O ye nations, His people.'
In any case the praise of Gentiles is predicted.
Archibald T. Robertson: Rejoice, ye Gentiles (ευφρανθητε). First aorist passive imperative of ευφραινω, old word from ευ, well and φρην, mind. See Luke 15:32. Quotation from Deuteronomy 32:43 (LXX).
John Gill: rejoice ye Gentiles with his people; which from the Hebrew text are by some rendered, 'rejoice his people O ye Gentiles'
the nations shall praise Israel; see what is the praise of this people that cleave unto the Lord
let both Jews and Gentiles rejoice; let them rejoice together when they come to be fellow heirs, and of the same body, and partakers of the same promises and privileges
